case_vignette:
A 25-year-old male presents with 6 months of discoloration in the underarms. He denies any blisters or erosions in the areas. He denies any history of diabetes, insulin resistance, or weight gain. He denies itch. He denies discoloration only with sweating. Physical examination reveals reddish-brown patches in the underarms; Wood's lamp reveals coral red fluorescence. The patient is a 25-year-old female.

question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have had discoloration in my underarms for the past 6 months.
Has the discoloration been constant or has it changed over time?
The discoloration has been constant over the past 6 months.
Do you have any other symptoms such as itching or irritation in the affected area?
No, I do not have any itching or irritation in the affected area.
Have you tried any treatments or changes in your skincare routine for this issue?
I haven't mentioned trying any treatments or changes in my skincare routine for this issue.
Do you have a history of diabetes or any hormonal disorders such as thyroid disease?
No, I do not have a history of diabetes, insulin resistance, or any weight gain issues.
Do any of your family members have similar skin changes or any relevant skin conditions?
I haven't mentioned any family history of similar skin changes or relevant skin conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Acanthosis nigricans.
